CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 11, 1961, pg. 1A, reads: "Paul E. Thompson" Portion of accompanying article reads: "Lynn V. Hooe Sr. and Paul Thompson - Two Negroes Earn High Scout Awards - Two Negroes were among 19 outstanding volunteer leaders receiving the Silver Beaver Award at the annual meeting of the Boy Scouts of America at Syria Mosque, Monday night. They are Lynn V. Hooe Sr., of 3119 Iowa St., Troop 93, and Paul E. Thompson of 921 Adelaide St. ...Thompson, also a devoted scouter for over 20 years, has been an assistant Scoutmaster, Scoutmaster, neighborhood commissioner, and assistant district commissioner for round tables.  He also is the holder of the Scouter's Award and Scoutmaster's Key Member of the Order of the Arrow and Wooden Badge man. He has organized scouts units and has had a primary part in giving the program of scouting to the boys in Hill District."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Paul E. Thompson wearing Boy Scout Silver Beaver award, posed in interior with marble wainscoting, possibly Syria Mosque
